docs.snippet: ILO, the restaurant in the Bryant Park Hotel, will close next Wednesday after a three-year run. Plans are for it to move downtown and to keep its chef, RICK LAAKKONEN. The restaurant in the hotel is to reopen in November after a renovation by DAVI...
docs.abstract: Ilo restaurant in Bryant Park Hotel will close after three years, move downtown and re-open as Yuji, with Chinese menu; chef Rick Laakkonen will remain; Medina restaurant opens at Tenth Ave and 28th Street; photo of owners, Hicham Enhaili and Sahle Ghebreyesus; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: ILO, the restaurant in the Bryant Park Hotel, will close next Wednesday after a three-year run. Plans are for it to move downtown and to keep its chef, RICK LAAKKONEN. The restaurant in the hotel is to reopen in November after a renovation by DAVID ROCKWELL, with a Chinese menu prepared by YUJI WAKIYA, a Japanese chef. Mr. Wakiya, who has restaurants in Tokyo, is a friend of the chef NOBU MATSUHISA, who will own and run the restaurant, tentatively named YUJI; backers include ROBERT DE NIRO. MEDINA opens today at 315 Tenth Avenue (28th Street), in a part of Manhattan that could use an oasis like this. The owners are HICHAM ENHAILI, below left, a native of Morocco who has been a manager at Mercer Kitchen, 66 and Bread Tribeca; and SAHLE GHEBREYESUS below right, one of three brothers who own Caffé Adulis and La Piazza in New Haven. Moroccan dishes prepared by AZIZ KHROUCH and AZIZ NOUIRA, who worked at La Mamounia in Marrakesh, will be served in fabric-swathed alcoves and in a tented garden.

docs.snippet: Now the sedentary fan can really relax while rooting for the home team. Maytag has introduced the SkyBox, a home vending machine that can be plugged in next to the La-Z-Boy and can dispense up to 64 12-ounce cans of drinks. The unit, which is refr...
docs.abstract: Maytag introduces refrigerated home vending machine that can dispense up to 64 12-ounce cans of drinks; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Now the sedentary fan can really relax while rooting for the home team. Maytag has introduced the SkyBox, a home vending machine that can be plugged in next to the La-Z-Boy and can dispense up to 64 12-ounce cans of drinks. The unit, which is refrigerated, is about two feet wide and three high and has an optional stand that holds bags of snacks. Team logos and push-button panels for dozens of beers and soft drinks are available. The price is about $600, with accessories, at Home Depot stores and Maytag appliance centers.

headline.main: If the 7th-Inning Stretch Is Just Too Strenuous

docs.snippet: How do you say ''strawberry shortcake'' in French? One glorious translation is Saint-Honoré aux fraises, as interpreted by Florian Bellanger, the executive pastry chef for Fauchon. Mr. Bellanger has added strawberries to the classic Parisian cake...
docs.abstract: Fauchon is offering decadent strawberry shortcake, but on weekends only; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: How do you say ''strawberry shortcake'' in French? One glorious translation is Saint-Honoré aux fraises, as interpreted by Florian Bellanger, the executive pastry chef for Fauchon. Mr. Bellanger has added strawberries to the classic Parisian cake, named for the patron saint of bakers, which consists of a flaky pastry base, a filling of pastry cream blended with whipped cream, topped with a crown of puff pastry decorated with caramelized cream puffs. Strawberry preserves are layered in the filling, and ripe berries with more whipped cream decorate the top. This indulgence -- available as an individual pastry ($5.50), and in sizes to serve four to six ($28) or eight to 10 ($50) -- is sold at the Fauchon stores only on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.

headline.main: Let's See, Who's the Patron Saint of 'Ooh'?

docs.abstract: New ice cube trays permit slice of lemon or lime to be frozen into center of cube for use in favorite beverages; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: For ice that offers both eye appeal and flavor, a new set of trays permits a slice of lemon or lime to be frozen right into the center of the cube, then popped out for iced tea or a vodka and tonic. You might use nicely trimmed slices of mango or watermelon instead.

headline.main: Vodka and Tonic Never Had It So Good

docs.snippet: Michael and Ann Warren, the owners of Cupcake Cafe, have opened Casa Cupcake, 545 Ninth Avenue (40th Street) an oasis for coffee. But they do not serve cupcakes. ''You can get them at Cupcake Cafe across the street,'' Mr. Warren said. ''We have bi...
docs.abstract: Michael and Ann Warren open Casa Cupcake, oasis for coffee, on Ninth Avenue and 40th Street; photos (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael and Ann Warren, the owners of Cupcake Cafe, have opened Casa Cupcake, 545 Ninth Avenue (40th Street) an oasis for coffee. But they do not serve cupcakes. ''You can get them at Cupcake Cafe across the street,'' Mr. Warren said. ''We have biscotti and doughnuts, things we like better with coffee.'' A generous $3 cappuccino, right, is topped with a head of creamy froth that would do a glass of Guinness proud. La Colombe Torrefaction supplies the espresso beans. Right now the cafe's look suggests an archaeological dig, with patches of exposed brick and marble slabs as counters and tables.

headline.main: A Coffee Shop With Sweet Ancestry

docs.snippet: Pastry chefs often toy with commercial icons like Rice Krispies treats and Ring Dings. For Easter, on April 11, Luci Levere, the pastry chef at Town, 15 West 56th Street, will make marshmallow bunnies and chicks to go on her petits fours tray. The...
docs.abstract: Luci Levere, pastry chef at Town, will make marshmallow bunnies and chicks to go on her petits fours tray; bunnies get their blush and fruity taste from raspberry puree; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Pastry chefs often toy with commercial icons like Rice Krispies treats and Ring Dings. For Easter, on April 11, Luci Levere, the pastry chef at Town, 15 West 56th Street, will make marshmallow bunnies and chicks to go on her petits fours tray. The treats suggest Marshmallow Peeps but have a real flavor difference. The bunnies get their blush and fruity taste from raspberry purée, and the chicks are tart-sweet with passion fruit, which also imparts their golden color. The marshmallows will be available at brunch ($65 prix fixe) and dinner ($69).

headline.main: Hope the Easter Bunny Likes Surprises

docs.snippet: Prosciutto and melon may be a classic pairing, but at this time of year, fresh melon does not live up to its half of the bargain. Instead, consider narrow wedges of French glacé melon, which resembles dried fruit but is fragrant, lush and moist, ...
docs.abstract: French glace melon pairs well with prosciutto or other cured hams; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Prosciutto and melon may be a classic pairing, but at this time of year, fresh melon does not live up to its half of the bargain. Instead, consider narrow wedges of French glacé melon, which resembles dried fruit but is fragrant, lush and moist, with a rich concentration of melon flavor. It is a sublime foil not only for prosciutto but also for other cured hams like serrano and spicy coppa. The melon is also excellent with cheese or in a fruit salad. It is $6.99 a pound at Fairway markets, where it is called dried melon.

headline.main: In a Midwinter Wedding of Sweet and Salty, The Ham Needn't Be the Better Half

docs.snippet: Fresh shrimp from Maine, in season until early March, are delicious cooked ever so briefly in water as salty as the sea, then peeled and eaten for a feast of sweet little mouthfuls. They are also good to smoke lightly. Line a wok and its cover wit...
docs.abstract: Florence Fabricant article on fresh shrimp from Maine; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Fresh shrimp from Maine, in season until early March, are delicious cooked ever so briefly in water as salty as the sea, then peeled and eaten for a feast of sweet little mouthfuls. They are also good to smoke lightly. Line a wok and its cover with foil, place two tablespoons each of brown sugar, white rice and black tea leaves in the bottom, cover the wok and place it over high heat. In about five minutes, fragrant smoke should start to rise. Place the raw shrimp in their shells on a rack in the wok, cover again and smoke about 10 minutes, then serve the shrimp alone with a dipping sauce. The shrimp are often sold with their heads on, $5.99 to $7.99 a pound at stores like Wild Edibles, above.

headline.main: Fresh From Maine, Tiny Bites From the Ocean

docs.snippet: O.K., smarty-pants, answer this true or false question: In the Bible, Noah gets drunk on wine. And how about this one: is tempura originally Japanese, Chinese, Portuguese or Italian?    Question-and-answer cards, ''Wine Smarts'' and ''Food Smarts,...
docs.abstract: Question-and-answer cards, Wine Smarts and Food Smarts, could be fun for holiday guests; photos (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: O.K., smarty-pants, answer this true or false question: In the Bible, Noah gets drunk on wine. And how about this one: is tempura originally Japanese, Chinese, Portuguese or Italian? Question-and-answer cards, ''Wine Smarts'' and ''Food Smarts,'' could keep your holiday guests giggling. The sets of cards, published by SmartsCo of San Francisco, are $25 each at Eli's Manhattan and W.I.N.E. (Answers to the questions: true, Portuguese.)

headline.main: Cards for Fun, And for Deals

docs.snippet: Think you know your beers? How about Keo, a lightly bitter citrus-sharp lager from Cyprus that is terrific with cheese? Or Castelain, a fruity ale from France; or the robust Layla Dirty Blonde lager from Israel; or Casablanca, a spicy and rich lag...
docs.abstract: Beers from Mediterranean are being served at Molyvos, Greek restaurant in Midtown; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Think you know your beers? How about Keo, a lightly bitter citrus-sharp lager from Cyprus that is terrific with cheese? Or Castelain, a fruity ale from France; or the robust Layla Dirty Blonde lager from Israel; or Casablanca, a spicy and rich lager from Morocco?
